div.h2: One District, One Community, One School System

p.style: text-align: center;

strong.span:
Update on Moultonborough Schools response to COVID-19
Please be aware that the COVID-19 is a rapidly evolving event.
Moultonborough School District's response changes to meet the rapidly changing circumstances. Please check this website daily for any news or adjustments.
Thank you.
For more information, please see Distance Learning page.
All athletic and co-curricular activities are canceled for the duration of the closure.
Distance Learning is in effect for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year.
Please be aware that the district buildings are closed to visitors,

p.span: except for meal pickups from food serviceand for picking up learning supplies and food/toiletries available in the Academy foyer on Mondays.
I

f you need to access any of the buildings or personnel, please call for an appointment. We will be practicing CDC recommendations for social distancing during these interactions, including the wearing of masks.
Thank you.
From all of us at the Moultonborough Schools:
Have a safe and restful April Break (April 27-May 1)!
Distance Learning resumes May 4, 2020.

p.style: font-size: 13.3333px;

strong.span:
UPDATE APRIL 23, 2020
From Patrick Andrew, Supt.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
p.span: A huge thank you to staff, students and families for making the best of this difficult situation. Distance learning is not the way we wanted to end theschoolyear. Thank you to all for yourefforts to continue the learning remotely.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
p.span: Calendar:The MoultonboroughSchoolBoard met April 23, 2020, to discuss theschoolcalendar for the remainder of this 2019-2020schoolyear. I am pleased to report the following:

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
p.span: June 16 Last day ofschoolfor students grades pk-11 (originalschoolcalendar end date)

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; margin-left: 0.5in; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;
p.span: June 13 Virtual(?) Graduation celebration, In-person graduation TBD at a later date

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; margin-left: 0.5in; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;
p.span: June 2 Last day fornewinstruction

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; margin-left: 0.5in; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;
p.span: June 2 Grades soft close Remediation available next 10 days

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; margin-left: 0.5in; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;
p.span: June 2- June 16 Remediation as needed, enrichment and celebration

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; margin-left: 0.5in; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;
p.span: June 2-16 Staggered access toschoolfor students, if needed to return/pick up materials

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; text-indent: 0.5in;

span.em: We will not be making up the two snow days from this year.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;
p.span: We hope that knowing these dates now adds some certainty to an otherwise uncertain situation. Look for more guidance on the details for end of the year activities to come from your childs principal.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;
p.span: Expanded Counseling Service Access: In an effort to further support students, we have expanded access to counseling services through our partnership with Norther Human Services, A letter from the Director of Counseling detailing how to access those services can be found here.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;
p.span: Continued Meal Service: Please know that we will be continuing meal service to any Moultonborough student during the April break and until the end of theschoolyear. Please contact Caf Services atmeals@sau45.orgif you would like to sign up for this service.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;
p.span: My sincerest wishes for a safe and productive end to the 2019-2020schoolyear. We are all in this together and together we will all get through this.

p.style: text-align: center;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;

span.span: Meals Pickup Program will be continuing through April Vacation!

br.br: As we continue our efforts to support our students and our community through these trying times, we would like to take the opportunity to remind you that applications for meal benefit assistance (free & reduced priced school meals)

em.strong: are accepted throughout the year, and that our office continues to accept and process new applications.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;
p.span: If you have experienced a layoff, loss of employment or even simply a reduction in hours due to the COVID-19 crisis, you may now qualify for meal benefit assistance from USDA.

p.style: text-align: left;
p.span: More information on how to apply for meal benefit assistance can be found on the Distance Learning page onSchool Meals or by clicking here for English and here for Spanish.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana;
span.span: Moultonborough School District is providing free bagged meals (breakfasts and lunches) for a three and two day time period. Meals are available for pick up Mondays and Thursdays between the hours of 8-11 at the Academy back kitchen doors.
Please email meals@sau45.org by 7 PM Sunday (for Monday pickup) & Wednesday (for Thursday pick up). Include in the email

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana; font-size: 16px;

p.span: with the childs name and if we need to be aware of any allergies.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Verdana;

p.span: Please feel free to ask any questions thru this email also and we will do our best to get you answers.

span.strong: A MESSAGE FROM THE Moultonborough SCHOOL BOARD:

p.style: font-size: 11pt;
p.span: March 18, 2020

p.style: font-size: 11pt;
p.span: From: Jonathan W. Tolman, School Board Chair

p.style: font-size: 11pt;
p.span: Good afternoon all,

p.style: font-size: 11pt;
p.span:
We are in unprecedented times and certainly unchartered waters. As you all know by now, the Governor has closed all public schools throughout the state and mandated that we go to Distance Learning. Superintendent Andrew has been on top of the situation even before this was official, working with our excellent administration and staff to prepare a plan for this new experience. He is in almost daily contact with me and your School Board has been getting updates as the situation unfolds. I cannot say enough how proud the School Board is of Mr. Andrew, our administration and every employee of the district who are stepping up to the plate in these stressful times to provide as much support as they can to our students!
Read full letter here...in English...en espanol...
April 16, 2020UPDATE is available here.
April 2, 2020 UPDATE is available here...and en espanol aqui.
March 27, 2020 UPDATE is available here...and en espanol aqui.
March 15, 2020 UPDATE is available here.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

strong.em: March 13, 2020 UPDATE is available here...and en espanol aqui.

strong.span: UPDATE is available here... and en espanol aqu

p.style: text-align: left;

span.strong: Welcome to our School District website.

br.br:
We hope that as you visit our site, you will get a snapshot of all that goes on in our District and in our schools: Moultonborough Central School and Moultonborough Academy. Our purpose here is to share the multiple facets of education within the Districtacademically, athletically, artistically, and socially.
Moultonborough School District grew from a kindergarten through 6th grade system to a K-12 SAU in 1980. For the past 38 years, our community has provided Moultonborough students with a comprehensive education including college prep and/or career ready academics, technology school opportunities, art, music, physical education, foreign languages, a variety of electives, co-curricular activities, and sports teams for every season.
Moultonborough is a community that values education and its local public schools. It is a community that desires the best for all students and has high expectations for those who serve the community's children.

h2.style: font-size: 20px; color: white; background-color: rgb(134, 13, 13); border-bottom: 8px solid rgb(96, 94, 94); font-family: asapbold; margin: 0px; padding: 7px; text-align: center;

p.style: text-align: center;

span.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; color: rgb(192, 80, 77);

p.span: Moultonborough Academy is ranked by US News & World Report as 5th Best New Hampshire high school!

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

div.span: This year is the fifth year in a row that MA has been in the top 10 high schools in the state. Congrats to our students, our educators, our support staff, our parents, and our community; together we earned this recognition.

p.style: text-align: center;

span.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; color: rgb(192, 80, 77);

a.style: color: rgb(17, 85, 204); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

br.br: MA students, Reese and George Lincoln, honor Earth Day during distance learning.

span.span: orest Fridays are an integral part of our Preschool Program. The learning and fun continue from home. Read along and find out what Forest Friday looks like for our wonderful group of preschool students. (Thanks to all those parents who shared their Forest Friday adventures with us.)

em.span: School maybe closed, but the Learning Continues...

span.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(192, 80, 77);

br.span: Students had the option of working with Composites in Manufacturing Technology Class. Alex is working with two pieces of slab oak to make whatis called a "River Table", where two pieces of wood are joined with a "river" of colored epoxy. Alex started this project at school and has continued to work towards finishing his project from home during remote learning.
